article.headline: Columbia 70, Cornell 61
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Jeremiah Boswell scored 14 points and Matt Preston added 12 points and 10 rebounds as Columbia defeated Cornell 70-61 on Saturday in the Ivy League opener for both teams. Columbia (9-4) opened the second half with a 13-6 run that turned a 36-34 halftime deficit into a 47-42 lead with 13:22 to play and the Lions didn't trail again. Dalen Cuff hit two 3-pointers in the burst and after Cornell's Eric Taylor tied the game at 42 with a free throw, Colin Montgomery made a 3-pointer and a layup. Columbia gradually expanded the lead to 61-49 with 5:23 remaining to send Cornell (5-9) to its second straight loss and fifth in seven games. Taylor led the Big Red with 15 points while Cody Toppert had 13 and Will Scott 11. Brett Loscalzo had 11 points for the Lions.
